comment: Really badly prepared professor. Moody and argumentative. Should not be allowed to instruct a class. Pity the students that attend his class.

His critiques can be brutal and he doesn't really teach anything except for stuff he likes which isn't even related to the class. He is unclear with deadlines and his grading is very harsh. Many people in my class have C's or D's. I always leave his class feeling deflated. He looks down upon supplies that arent the most expensive. Very superficial

I wouldnt suggest taking this class if you have any disorders that make learning difficult (ADHD, ADD, Autism, etc.) Youll rarely have time between projects and they will sometimes overlap. Some of his critiques are not helpful and unnecessary. He will not hesitate to call you out for making it mistake, even over the smallest things.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Nice guy. Easy to get along with. Unfair grading/grades all over the place. Expect to receive 5-20 points below what u usually get with every other professor out there. I always do very well in my classes/get along with the professors but in this one I noticed his fairness of grading was all over the place. Id avoid if possible. Glad its over!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Hes not a bad person I just dont think hes a very good professor. I had him for an online course this semester and hes probably the most confusing professor Ive had. The way he grades is pretty inconsistent, so sometimes I dont know if Ill do good on a project or not. He also rambles a lot during meetings without explaining much of anything.

DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR. He's a nice guy and maybe he's a much better in person, but for an online class, definitely not. He didn't teach at all; just linked us to videos made by other people on how to draw. Ask for a 1-1 session to make up a missed class? He'll set one up then later cancel saying the info sheet is clear enough. Very stressful.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: Professor Waronker isn't a bad person per se, but he definitely does not understand his students. he treats everyone like they are a mini version of him and if you are different, well good luck. he is quick to remind you participation in class is fourteen percent of your grade, but even if you talk once per class, you'll still only get a c.

This class helps new architecture students understand what architecture is all about.   It gets you to really think about how important architecture is, and how architects can help make the world a more interesting place.   Lots of subjects were presented through readings and class discussion.   Waronker really made me think.
He covered alot of things about architecture and opened me to thinking about it in ways that I never expected or imagined.    Lots of ideas, images, readings, conversation.

Worst professor. Assigned a ridiculous amount of super long essays. Failed almost the whole class. Didnt teach a thing, just shows slides of buildings. Loved to remind us he went to Harvard. Loves threatening to fail students for stupid reasons. Strangest grading scale based on a complicated series of checks pluses and minus signs, makes no sense.
